identificationModule.briefTitle: A Trial to Evaluate the Safety Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of B1344 by Subcutaneous Injection in Healthy Subjects
identificationModule.officialTitle: A First-in-human, Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel, Placebo-controlled, Single Ascending Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of B1344 by Subcutaneous Injection in Healthy Subjects

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To evaluate the safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity of B1344 by single subcutaneous (s.c.) injection in healthy subjects

interventions.name: B1344
interventions.description: multi-site abdominal s.c. injections (maximum 2 mL at each site)
otherNames: pegylated conjugate of recombinant human mutated fibroblast growth factor 21

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: multi-site abdominal s.c. injections (maximum 2 mL at each site)

primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the screening period to 29 days after administration

primaryOutcomes.description: The examination of both kidneys using medical ultrasonography will be performed to detect any harmful abscesses, fluid collection, and infection within or around the kidneys.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the screening period to 29 days after administration

primaryOutcomes.description: Number of participants with abnormal Physical examinations.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the screening period to 90 days after administration

primaryOutcomes.description: The injection site reaction assessment will be done by the PI/investigational staff and study subject using the criteria, which consist of rating the severity of redness, swelling, skin temperature, sensitivity and pain at the injection site.
he incidence and proportion of ADA positive subjects.

locations.facility: California Clinical Trials Medical Group, Inc.
